docs.text: Nettopologie Dataproduct This data product for EnergyHubs describes which information and data to exchange between DSO and customer/advisor when establishing an EnergyHub. A minimum set of data is defined that all operators are expected to conform to, along with a number of optional properties and data types. The data is intended to be presented as a hierarchy with a TopologyDataSet at its root, then Substation-s nested inside the TopologyDataSet. A grid connection ( Aansluiting ) is defined as a UsagePoint and related to a Bay through EnergyConnection-s . classDiagram direction RL class Line { Location location string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class Substation { Location location string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class Bay { Substation substation string description string m_rid docs.text: This data product for EnergyHubs describes which information and data to exchange between DSO and customer/advisor when establishing an EnergyHub. A minimum set of data is defined that all operators are expected to conform to, along with a number of optional properties and data types. The data is intended to be presented as a hierarchy with a TopologyDataSet at its root, then Substation-s nested inside the TopologyDataSet. A grid connection ( Aansluiting ) is defined as a UsagePoint and related to a Bay through EnergyConnection-s . classDiagram direction RL class Line { Location location string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class Substation { Location location string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class Bay { Substation substation string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class EnergyConnection { boolean aggregate boolean normally_in_service EquipmentContainer equipment_container Location location string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class UsagePoint { Equipment equipments string connection_category string description string european_article_number_ean string m_rid Name names string short_name } class StreetAddress { TownDetail town_detail string postal_code string po_box string language } class Location { CoordinateSystem coordinate_system StreetAddress main_address PowerSystemResource power_system_resources PositionPoint position_points string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class CoordinateSystem { string crs_urn string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class PositionPoint { Location location integer sequence_number string x_position string y_position string z_position } class TownDetail { string code string section string state_or_province string country } class TopologyDataSet { string identifier string contact_point string conforms_to date release_date string version Substation substations } TopologyDataSet --> Substation : substations Line --> Location : location Substation --> Location : location EnergyConnection --> Location : location UsagePoint --> EnergyConnection : equipments StreetAddress --> TownDetail : town_detail Location --> CoordinateSystem : coordinate_system Location --> StreetAddress : main_address PositionPoint --> Location : location Bay --> Substation : substation EnergyConnection --> Bay : equipment_container

docs.text: name : ConductingEquipment description : The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : Equipment attributes : aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. \nThe attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normally_in_service : name : normally_in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normally_in_service owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false equipment_container : name : equipment_container description : Container of this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.EquipmentContainer alias : equipment_container owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : EquipmentContainer required : false multivalued : false location : name : location description : Location of this power system resource. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:PowerSystemResource.Location alias : location owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - PowerSystemResource - PositionPoint range : Location required : false multivalued : false description : name : description description : The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.description alias : description owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType - NameTypeAuthority range : string required : false multivalued : false m_rid : name : m_rid description : "Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID\ \ is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved\ \ by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is\ \ strongly recommended.\r\nFor CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to\ \ IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify\ \ CIM object elements." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : m_rid owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false names : name : names description : All names of this identified object. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.Names alias : names owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType range : Name required : false multivalued : true short_name : name : short_name description : The attribute is used for an exchange of a human readable short name with length of the string 12 characters maximum. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.shortName alias : short_name owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false class_uri : cim:ConductingEquipment

IdentifiedObject Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:EnergyConnection native this:EnergyConnection LinkML Source Direct name : EnergyConnection description : A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : ConductingEquipment class_uri : cim:EnergyConnection Induced name : EnergyConnection description : A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : ConductingEquipment attributes : aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. \nThe attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normally_in_service : name : normally_in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normally_in_service owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false equipment_container : name : equipment_container description : Container of this equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.EquipmentContainer alias : equipment_container owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - Equipment range : EquipmentContainer required : false multivalued : false location : name : location description : Location of this power system resource. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:PowerSystemResource.Location alias : location owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - PowerSystemResource - PositionPoint range : Location required : false multivalued : false description : name : description description : The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. docs.text:
Class: NameType _Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is: _ _The localName is a human readable name of the object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation, VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have names that typically are unique among them. _ __ URI: cim:NameType classDiagram class NameType click NameType href "../NameType" NameType : description NameType : name_type_authority NameType --> "0..1" NameTypeAuthority : name_type_authority click NameTypeAuthority href "../NameTypeAuthority" NameType : names NameType --> "*" Name : names click Name href "../Name" Slots Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance description 0..1 String Description of the name type direct name_type_authority 0..1 NameTypeAuthority Authority responsible for managing names of this type direct names * Name All names of this type direct Usages used by used in type used Name name_type range NameType NameTypeAuthority name_types range NameType Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:NameType native this:NameType LinkML Source Direct name : NameType description : "Type of name. An object may also have different\ \ names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14.\ \ The definition from CIM14 is:
The localName is a human readable name of the\ \ object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to\ \ a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation,\ \ VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have\ \ names that typically are unique among them.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 attributes : description : name : description description : "Description of the name type.

docs.text: NettopologieDataproduct This data product for EnergyHubs describes which information and data to exchange between DSO and customer/advisor when establishing an EnergyHub. A minimum set of data is defined that all operators are expected to conform to, along with a number of optional properties and data types. The data is intended to be presented as a hierarchy with a TopologyDataSet at its root, then Substation-s nested inside the TopologyDataSet. A grid connection ( Aansluiting ) is defined as a UsagePoint and related to a Bay through EnergyConnection-s . classDiagram direction RL class Line { Location location string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class Substation { Location location string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class Bay { Substation substation string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class EnergyConnection { boolean aggregate boolean normally_in_service EquipmentContainer equipment_container Location location string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class UsagePoint { Equipment equipments string connection_category string description string european_article_number_ean string m_rid Name names string short_name } class StreetAddress { TownDetail town_detail string postal_code string po_box string language } class Location { CoordinateSystem coordinate_system StreetAddress main_address PowerSystemResource power_system_resources PositionPoint position_points string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class CoordinateSystem { string crs_urn string description string m_rid Name names string short_name } class PositionPoint { Location location integer sequence_number string x_position string y_position string z_position } class TownDetail { string code string section string state_or_province string country } class TopologyDataSet { string identifier string contact_point string conforms_to date release_date string version Substation substations } TopologyDataSet --> Substation : substations Line --> Location : location Substation --> Location : location EnergyConnection --> Location : location UsagePoint --> EnergyConnection : equipments StreetAddress --> TownDetail : town_detail Location --> CoordinateSystem : coordinate_system Location --> StreetAddress : main_address PositionPoint --> Location : location Bay --> Substation : substation EnergyConnection --> Bay : equipment_container Additional schemas JSON Schema Identifiers URI: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0

docs.text: Class: PositionPoint Set of spatial coordinates that determine a point, defined in the coordinate system specified in 'Location.CoordinateSystem'. Use a single position point instance to describe a point-oriented location. Use a sequence of position points to describe a line-oriented object (physical location of non-point oriented objects like cables or lines), or area of an object (like a substation or a geographical zone - in this case, have first and last position point with the same values). docs.text: Class: PowerSystemResource A power system resource (PSR) can be an item of equipment such as a switch, an equipment container containing many individual items of equipment such as a substation, or an organisational entity such as sub-control area. Power system resources can have measurements associated. docs.text: Slot: aggregate _The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. _ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection. URI: cim:Equipment.aggregate Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot Equipment The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanic... no EnergyConnection A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model no ConductingEquipment The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that a... no Properties Range: Boolean Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:Equipment.aggregate native this:aggregate LinkML Source name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated\ \ (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for\ \ equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent\ \ the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance\ \ of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together\ \ as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples\ \ would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled\ \ as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. \n\ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : Equipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false

It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. _ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection. URI: cim:Equipment.aggregate

docs.text: Slot: crs_urn A Uniform Resource Name (URN) for the coordinate reference system (crs) used to define 'Location.PositionPoints'. An example would be the European Petroleum Survey Group (EPSG) code for a coordinate reference system, defined in URN under the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) namespace as: urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::XXXX, where XXXX is an EPSG code (a full list of codes can be found at the EPSG Registry web site http://www.epsg-registry.org/). To define the coordinate system as being WGS84 (latitude, longitude) using an EPSG OGC, this attribute would be urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::4236. A profile should limit this code to a set of allowed URNs agreed to by all sending and receiving parties. docs.text: Slot: m_rid _Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. _ For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements. docs.text: _Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. _ For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements. docs.text: Slot: normally_in_service Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.
